text:
features 
• Lat
e decelerations are repetitive and periodic slowing of the fetal heart rate with onset mid to end of the
contraction and the lowest point more than 20 seconds after the peak of the contraction, and ending after the
contraction
o They can be indicative of fetal hypoxemia.
o In the presence of a tracing with no accelerations and reduced variability, the definition of late decelerations
also includes those with an amplitude of 10–15 bpm.
• T
he sinusoidal pattern is a regular, smoo
